skill.name: Skill Development
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user wants to "create a skill", "add a skill to plugin", "write a new skill", "improve skill description", "organize skill content", or needs guidance on skill structure, progressive disclosure, or skill development best practices for Claude Code plugins.

skill.author: unknown

security_audit.summary: Official skill content with guidance and references only. No executable code or external access is included in this directory.

content.user_title: Build a plugin skill with clear structure
content.value_statement: You need a reliable process to create a Claude Code plugin skill. This skill provides steps, structure, and writing rules.
actual_capabilities: Explain required skill folder structure and required files
Provide a step by step skill creation workflow
Define frontmatter rules and trigger phrase guidance
Detail progressive disclosure and file placement guidance
Provide validation checklist and common mistakes to avoid
limitations: No automated validation or packaging scripts in this skill directory
No code generation or templates beyond examples in the text
No integration with external repositories or services
No testing of skills in a live Claude Code environment

use_cases.title: Create a new skill
use_cases.description: Follow the step sequence to design and structure a new skill for a plugin.

use_cases.title: Improve skill clarity
use_cases.description: Refine SKILL.md wording, triggers, and organization for better activation.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill setup
use_cases.description: Apply a shared checklist and progressive disclosure rules across team skills.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Need structure for a new plugin skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill outline for a Claude Code plugin. Include frontmatter triggers, folders, and a brief SKILL.md structure.

prompt_templates.title: Improve triggers
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill description and propose stronger trigger phrases in third person format. Keep the description concise.

prompt_templates.title: Plan resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Given these example tasks, list which scripts, references, and assets should be added to the skill and why.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this SKILL.md against the validation checklist. List missing items and suggest improvements.

output_examples.input: Help me create a new skill for plugin hooks and keep it lean.
output: Define trigger phrases in third person frontmatter
Keep SKILL.md focused on core procedures
Move detailed patterns to references files
Add scripts only for repeatable tasks

best_practices: Use specific trigger phrases in third person frontmatter
Keep SKILL.md lean and move details to references
Include a validation checklist before release
anti_patterns: Write second person instructions in SKILL.md
Place all details in a single large SKILL.md file

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code plugins?
faq.answer: Yes. It is written specifically for Claude Code plugin skills and their folder structure.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not run scripts or create files automatically.

faq.question: How do I integrate it into my plugin?
faq.answer: Place the skill folder under your plugin skills directory and ensure SKILL.md is present.

faq.question: Does it handle my data safely?
faq.answer: It is static guidance content and does not transmit or store data.

faq.question: What if the skill does not trigger?
faq.answer: Review trigger phrases and ensure the description uses third person wording.

faq.question: How does it compare to other skill guides?
faq.answer: It is tailored to Claude Code plugins and emphasizes progressive disclosure.
